result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Danielle R Voelkel

defendant.name: Voelkel, Danielle R
defendant.address: 1612 S Green Ridge Ter, New Berlin 53151

records.addlTxt:
9:41 AM; Case called for Hearing. District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin by Nikole Kane. Defendant Danielle R Voelkel in court.  Attorney Brandon K. Carlson in court for Danielle R Voelkel. Atty. Carlson provides an update; he has an offer but is still waiting on the digital discovery from the State.  Atty. Carlson requests another further proceedings date in about 45 days.  Court inquires as to why some discovery is still outstanding.  State advises the request for digital came in August and they followed up with the Police Department this morning with respect to the digital discovery and are awaiting a response.  Court will expect that the State has provided all outstanding discovery to Defense by the next court date.  Court adjourns for further proceedings.
Hearing scheduled for November 7, 2022 at 09:00 am.

9:23 AM; Case called for Hearing. Prosecuting attorney Jack A. Pitzo in court for the State of Wisconsin.   Defendant Danielle R Voelkel in court.  Attorney Brandon K. Carlson in court for Danielle R Voelkel.  Atty. Carlson provides an update, he has some discovery but needs to follow-up with respect to digital discover as well as an offer.  State will provide the offer to defense counsel today and will make sure file is routed to the ADA assigned with respect to discovery.  Atty. Carlson requests another further proceedings date in about 30-45 days. Court adjourns for further proceedings.
Hearing scheduled for September 30, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Effective August 1, 2022, this case is assigned to Branch 7 Judicial Vacancy, pursuant to 22-SO-04(67).

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: Defendant waives her right to a Preliminary Hearing.

09:14 AM Defendant Danielle R Voelkel in court with attorney Brandon K. Carlson.  Andrea M Will appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  The Court finds that the Defendant's waiver to a preliminary hearing is knowing and voluntary.  Waive reading of Information.  NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.  Hearing scheduled for August 22, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Preliminary hearing on July 25, 2022 at 09:15 am.

Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing.  Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed.  Defendant not to possess any drug paraphernalia.  Defendant to have no contact with any Walmart.

08:27 AM Defendant Danielle R Voelkel in court with attorney Brandon K. Carlson.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern Abigail Kincheloe appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives reading of complaint.  Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties.  Preliminary Hearing requested.  Preliminary time limits waived.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 25, 2022 at 09:15 am.
Attorney Brandon Carlson has been appointed to represent the defendant.
State's Demand for Discovery and Inspection and Notice of Intent to Use Defendant's Statement and DNA Evidence.
